sentences.text: Two seconds till I work out what's going on with my video.
It must be early in the morning for you.
I'm located in India and I'm at four PM in the evening.
Yeah, I thought it said two 30 in the morning or something that blinkin' heck.
We've got a remote team that works 24 or seven.
S, folks sitting in the U.
I take care of the european territory.
So I'll be the point of contact for you today.
This is the very first time we're catching up.
My name is Rakesh and I take care of sales at hiver for the U.
K as well as the european territory.
I have been with the company for over four years, got a personal onboarded, more than 500 teams.
So today, we're going to be looking at your specific needs in question and let you know if this is a good platform towards the end of the day.
So we're a small company in Edinburgh in scotland U.
And we provide TV aerial services, door entry, access control.
And a lot of our customers are like housing associations and councils.
So it's kind of public services and the like.
And we are struggling with emails a little bit.
So we're just looking at a different way of managing it.
We have an in house system for job management, but it doesn't integrate with any email systems.
So we're trying to decide whether we go down the route of a new system completely that has email built in or whether we could use something like hiver as an add on.
So we've obviously been playing around with it for a few days.
Now, me and another office person, one of the office managers, val, she's been playing around with it.
We quite like the look of it.
But I think as I said, in our email, the one problem we've got is how we link in our, so at the moment we drag and drop emails from outlook into our system which is just a folder view.
So it's attached to each and every job.
And while it's clunky and problematic, we need to find hiver doesn't have that.
So we need to find a way whether it's programmatically or some other way of getting emails easily into our system or attached to our system or linked to our system.
So, yeah, I don't know if you can help with that or if you could put us in the right direction.
I mean with regards to management of communication, as long as these emails are coming into your common group inbox, that I noticed that you've got set up at an other company domain.
And then we've got another accounts.
I believe that's another shared inbox.

So we can help you manage all of these, of course, help you organize these emails, better deflect the emails that do not require your attention, run reporting on top of what is important, what is not.
And on top of it, like you said, you've got your existing system to manage the entire jobs.
So what you're doing what you're looking to do from my understanding, let me know if this is incorrect.
Yeah, anytime you receive a request from a customer that has to have a job allocated to it, you want this conversation to be linked to that job card?
Yeah, that would be really good if you could.
It doesn't need to be in our job.
I mean, I can show you briefly what our system.
I've got an it background and I wrote it like it's… really clunky and horrible.
I can't show you or send you some screenshots and let you see how it works.
But I don't mind how we link in even if worst case, it might be that the conversation's finished, we download it and then drag and drop it.
But if there's a programmatic easy programmatic way to do it and it works well, then that would be even better, you know.
We do give the open API access by the way.
I mean, if that can help you kind of have two systems talk to each other.
We can look into this requirement now that's something that I do want to keep it on hold burner for now.
Let's go ahead and create a complete system as a solution to manage your incoming requests today.
Can I try and understand, so, how many emails?
How many conversations do you currently deal with on an everyday basis amongst a team of four, five folks?
There's five of us in the office.
So it's not a massive amount.
Let me have a look and see if I can get a snapshot of it's.
So that's another problem we solve like while you go ahead and look at those emails today, hiver gives you a ready to use reporting where if somebody asks you, what do we deal with in a daily basis?
How many open pending closed jobs do you have today?
To it, I believe you're frozen.
So there's 50 to 100 emails yesterday, about 60 or 70 emails yesterday.
So it's not a massive amount this morning.
But the problem we're having is not, it's not the volume of emails.
It's when there's a conversation going on.
We have one person that's responsible for the mailboxes, and they, that rotates between a couple of people.
So the converse, the response to an email never goes back to the same person.
So a person picks it up, they have to learn everything about that job, and it just, it's a waste of time and energy.
So it would be good, if a conversation is going on about a job or about whatever subject it is that it goes to the same person.
And we've tried that out this week and it works really quite well.
You know, I sent an email and then the response to that email came back to my assigned person.
And another problem that we're going to be solving here for you is like you literally had to go manually, look at the number of emails, right?
I know, I've seen your stats already, man?
The statistics in hybrid will always tell you what's happening for a day, which representative, or what sort of emails, how long are we taking to respond to those?
How many of them are open, pending close requests for a day?
And of course, you can then make strategic decisions on what category of females do we really deal with?
And are these certain emails that do not require your attention?
That will be like auto closed by hybrid in the workflow, then assigning emails to the right set of people as per the jobs, the skill assessments, and everything.
Now, apart from that, given that if you're trying to look at the solution and want to fix that, any timelines that you're looking at?
Well, I mean we want to play around with it over the next few weeks, maybe even to the next month, just me and this other office manager just so we can get into it.
If we're doing it, be well, potentially as soon as possible.
But most likely January, the reason being is we're just about to hit the run up to Christmas and it's getting, quite busy.
And I think it might, you know, if we can roll it out and get people trained on it, which it doesn't need a lot of training.

If we can do that in December, you know, in a couple weeks, then we'll certainly do it, you know, but I think realistically I, there's… two things two, well, one, we need to solve the API issue and how that links and that's that relies on me doing the coding.
So that's going to take me a few weeks because, I can't do it full time.
So if I can get that solved and we can play around with it for another week or two and it does the what we were hoping it would do, then we could probably roll that roll out soon after that.

So ideally at least by November when you enter into a new year, you really want to have a solution in place so that you are no more struggling with the management of the customer communication, you should have a solution and everybody should know what they need to do when they log in into hiver.
